meanings.definition: Relating to the development of an embryo.
meanings.sent1: The embryogenic process is crucial for the growth of a baby.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the embryogenic stages of a chick's development.
meanings.sent3: The embryogenic changes in the egg were so fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent4: Her nurturing nature was as embryogenic as a mother hen.
meanings.sent5: The embryogenic transformation from a tiny cell to a complex organism is truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: Capable of producing or developing an embryo.
meanings.sent1: Certain plants have embryogenic abilities to grow new life.
meanings.sent2: The embryogenic potential of the seed was evident in its rapid growth.
meanings.sent3: The embryogenic power of the soil seemed almost magical.
meanings.sent4: His creativity was as embryogenic as a seed sprouting into a plant.
meanings.sent5: The embryogenic nature of the environment allowed for new beginnings to flourish.
